docs.snippet: Televised discussion sessions on the issues of the day allow President Trump to show the public how he does his job. It’s a form of performance art for a president who has the instincts of a showman.

headline.print_headline: Trump’s New Reality Show Airs Live From the West Wing
headline.main: Live From the West Wing, Trump Pulls Back the Curtain

docs.snippet: An Indiana Senate candidate who carries a cardboard cutout of Donald Trump to campaign rallies, dons a "Make America Great Again" hat in a TV ad and ridicules an opponent for being a "Never Trumper" called the eventual president "vulgar, if not pr...

headline.print_headline: Indiana GOP Senate Candidate Called Trump 'Vulgar' in 2016
headline.main: Indiana GOP Senate Candidate Called Trump 'Vulgar' in 2016

docs.snippet: Three state laws make it impossible for federal immigration officials to deport criminals born outside the United States, the Justice Department said in a lawsuit.

headline.print_headline: Justice Dept. Sues California Over State Immigration Laws
headline.main: Trump Administration Sues California Over Immigration Laws

docs.snippet: President Trump has claimed that he can achieve what has eluded his predecessors through the force of his own personality, but so far, he has little to show for that.

headline.print_headline: Another Pledge by Trump to Do What Nobody Else Can
headline.main: Trump’s Meeting With Kim Jong-un Is Another Pledge to Do What Nobody Else Can

docs.snippet: President Trump, who has vowed to the N.R.A. that “I will never, ever let you down,” seems likely to keep that promise given his bond with gun owners and their culture.

headline.print_headline: After Brief Rift, the President and the N.R.A. Appear to Be in Sync Again
headline.main: After Brief Split, Trump and N.R.A. Appear to Reconcile

docs.snippet: President Trump’s head-spinning moves on national security, the budget and trade left Washington reeling and a bewildered sense of resignation in the West Wing.

headline.print_headline: President Unbound, Aides Bewildered, Capital Reeling
headline.main: After Another Week of Chaos, Trump Repairs to Palm Beach. No One Knows What Comes Next.

docs.snippet: President Trump, looking to broaden the shake-up of his cabinet, has spoken to Energy Secretary Rick Perry about taking over the Department of Veterans Affairs.

headline.print_headline: Veterans Affairs Secretary May Be Next One Ousted
headline.main: Trump Eyes Replacing His Veterans Affairs Secretary With His Energy Chief

docs.snippet: Roberta S. Jacobson is one of the most experienced Latin America experts in the State Department, having spent most of her 31-year tenure focused on the region.

docs.snippet: If the Democrats win a special House race in Pennsylvania’s 18th District, the alarm bells will be audible across the country.
